lines.text: Mother is very busy to-day, dear. We'll try to have a little chat, to-morrow.
Why do my to-morrows never come?
Empty hearts. Empty lives. Empty homes. Poor little rich girl.
A school-room of my own is too big and lonesome. When my birthday comes, I can ask for what I like and it's going to be the Public School.
I don't want to be shut up, in that old car! I hate riding! I hate the chauffeur! I want to walk on my feet!
Mother promised to see me, just one little minute to-day.
So they punished the poor little rich girl, for wanting to be a free little poor girl.
Now you've spoiled the best fight I ever had.
It's my eleventh birthday. Be nice to me, Jane. I'm grown up. Won't you kiss me?
The poor little rich girl's mother, whose social duties seem of more importance than the happiness of her child.
